unnormalised: EdTech Sector Sees Surge in Scholarship Portal Usage, Boosting Access to Education
normalised: EdTech Sector Sees Surge in Scholarship Portal Usage, Boosting Access to Education

unnormalised: New Delhi: Online scholarship portals are experiencing a significant surge in traffic, as students across India gear up for the academic year. These platforms are becoming increasingly vital in bridging the financial gap for deserving candidates, democratizing access to quality education.
normalised: New Delhi: Online scholarship portals are experiencing a significant surge in traffic, as students across India gear up for the academic year. These platforms are becoming increasingly vital in bridging the financial gap for deserving candidates, democratizing access to quality education.

unnormalised: Several portals, including “Vidya Dhan” and “Scholarships India,” report a 40% increase in registrations compared to last year. Experts attribute this growth to increased internet penetration in rural areas and enhanced awareness about available opportunities.
normalised: Several portals, including “Vidya Dhan” and “Scholarships India,” report a forty percent increase in registrations compared to last year. Experts attribute this growth to increased internet penetration in rural areas and enhanced awareness about available opportunities.

unnormalised: "We're seeing a significant rise in applications from students in Tier-2 and Tier-3 cities, a testament to the growing reach of online resources," says Dr. Priya Sharma, an education technology analyst at IIT Delhi.
normalised: "We're seeing a significant rise in applications from students in Tier two and Tier three cities, a testament to the growing reach of online resources," says Doctor Priya Sharma, an education technology analyst at I I T Delhi.

unnormalised: Many portals are also leveraging AI to match students with relevant scholarships, streamlining the application process. This comes just in time, as families recover from the pandemic's economic impact and many are looking for ways to celebrate Onam without financial strain.
normalised: Many portals are also leveraging A I to match students with relevant scholarships, streamlining the application process. This comes just in time, as families recover from the pandemic's economic impact and many are looking for ways to celebrate Onam without financial strain.

unnormalised: These platforms offer scholarships ranging from Rs. 5,000 to Rs. 2,00,000, covering tuition fees, accommodation, and even living expenses. A recent success story highlighted the case of Lakshmi from Kerala, who secured a scholarship to study engineering in Chennai, calling it "a blessing better than a plate of hot biryani." The future looks bright for students aiming for higher education, thanks to these accessible resources.
normalised: These platforms offer scholarships ranging from rupee five thousand to rupee two hundred thousand, covering tuition fees, accommodation, and even living expenses. A recent success story highlighted the case of Lakshmi from Kerala, who secured a scholarship to study engineering in Chennai, calling it "a blessing better than a plate of hot biryani." The future looks bright for students aiming for higher education, thanks to these accessible resources.
